metadata.Title: CVE-2021-32495 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.Description:
Radare2 has a use-after-free vulnerability in pyc parser's get_none_objectfunction. Attacker can read freed memory afterwards. This will allowattackers to cause denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-32495` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libradare2-5.0.0 - 5.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu1
libradare2-common - 5.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu1
radare2 - 5.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: radare2 package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu1').
